website_summaries.verdict: The Nyko Perfect Shot is an affordable alternative to the Wii Zapper--we just wish it was as comfortable.
cons: Trigger is tougher to shoot than Wii Zapper

customer_reviews.title: No better than a Zapper for those who have enormous TV's/projector screens
customer_reviews.text: I chose this over the cabellas dangerous hunt rifle because it works with the shooters that don't allow you to change control maps (house of the dead). It's fun and it feels nice. I have a big projector screen, which is awful for trying to calibrate Wii remotes. This means that I have to look at the cursor on screen as opposed to looking down the barrel of this gun. When it comes to the immersion factor I'd probably be just as happy with a $6 Zapper. If you have a really big TV or projector screen then this isn't worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: casey scott

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I honestly hated this thing. I wanted a handgun equivalent to the zapper, but this thing was a huge pain. The trigger wasn't a very fluid pull-back motion and got hung up a lot on something. I kept feeling like it was going to break my controller. Don't bother with the gimmicky controller holders and just use the controller like normal.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Polk

customer_reviews.title: pistol grip peripheral
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Wii games: Chicken Riot and Reload and a pistol like peripheral made sense for that type of games. The handgun type grip feels good and prolongs game play and the accuracy is great. I tried playing with the zapper and cabelas gun peripherals but it they were not to my liking. I like this one because the trigger is located where a real life hand gun trigger would be.
customer_reviews.author: SEROQUIQUI

customer_reviews.title: makes a few games more fun
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted this and bought them used to get a few more miles out of the old Wii. They are fun for gun games on the wii.
customer_reviews.author: Stupid People are Annoying

customer_reviews.title: OK for rail games, otherwise useless
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for playing co-op and for both of them within a few months of light usage, first one and then the other gun no longer allowed me to attach the nunchuck. I don't think it is due to cheapness of material, I just think it was a poor and overly complicated design. So, if you are just playing a rail-type game which does not use the nunchuck, it is fine, although the handle is a bit big. Otherwise, stay away. Nerf also has a gun that converts a wiimote into a one handed pistol. It seems to be better built than this product. Plus, you get a Nerf gun!
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: It works and its cheap
customer_reviews.text: I have been dual weiling these guns and they work well. The feel is good, trigger is responsive, and they store easily. I don't really understand why people complain about having to remove the wrist wrap. It takes what 20-30 seconds or less to remove it or put it back on, is it THAT big of a deal? Seriously........ I will say that this will work for large hands, mine being very large but you will find that your pinky is grabbing air because the grip is a little short. I got these just to test, I'm going to upgrade to the larger magnum versions that will work better with my hands.
customer_reviews.author: TechMasseyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: The good thing about this product is that it is inexpensive, so you won't feel too ripped off when you realize it's not a good buy. I also like the feel of the trigger. The PerfectShot performs as advertised, but my big complaint is that the sights don't zero with the screen. Because of this it is very unnatural to use as when you go to shoot something, your natural reaction is too look down the sights and pull the trigger. When you do this your shot is way off target. You would better off using your Wii's controller.
customer_reviews.author: Angryloner

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I ordered unfortunately was not what I needed 👍
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gun, buy this over the Wii Zapper
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this gun and the Wii Zapper and the same time. I just wish I had purchased two of these instead. The Zappers is awkward and more difficult to control. The Perfect Shot on the other hand is just that, perfect. Easy to control and aim. The only draw back is with the game in general. It is not a light gun, because that is not how the Wii works. Which can make it difficult at time to aim correctly but with practice comes progress. If you are looking a gun for the Wii, this blows the Zapper out of the water. Not to mention shooting games are extremely fun.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M. Rinaldi

customer_reviews.title: Missing a piece
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item for my son, he said part of it was missing. Did not contact seller or pursue this
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Good but Not Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This gun is a good value and a much better option in my opinion compared to the Wii zapper. It is easy to use and has fair construction quality for a relatively inexpensive item. I gave it a 4 star rating because the feel isn't quite right to me. The Wii controller on the top of it makes it feel front heavy and not quite balanced right. Also I just don't like that I have to remove the strap from my controller to insert it. They should have designed it to hold the strap inside somehow, like with the guitar hero guitar. But overall a good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SRVFAN

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: bought for a game and it does seem to work alright the gun its self just is not that comfortable if playing for a long time. It is low price so to be expected. So bottom line not playing a lot then great gun for the money. If you play a lot get something a little more expensive and comfortable
customer_reviews.author: matthew demay

customer_reviews.title: Best gun accessory for the Wii to date...
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised the previous reviewer gave it just one star. I have both the Wii Zapper and the Wii Perfect Shotgun, and the Perfect Shotgun wins hands down. While the Zapper is too small, made for the grip of an 8 year old, the Perfect Shotgun was clearly designed for an adult hand. And the aiming (House of the Dead & Umbrella Chronicles) is very good. The only drawback with any accessory is that not all Wii games are compatible. Make sure before you buy a game that it's compatible with one or all gun accessories. Resident Evil 4 heartbreakingly is not :(
customer_reviews.author: Lipplog

customer_reviews.title: Ok as a gun.  I use the controller by itself...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why people couldn't get the controller in the gun, I had no problem. The weight distribution is a bit of a problem; the controller goes in the barrel making it top/front heavy and tiring to hold up. It is not 100% accurate as the light gun in the original Nintendo light gun was... Where you aim the gun physically is not exactly where the pointer on the screen appears. I tried calibrating it in the Wii menu but it's still not that accurate. I think this is an inherent problem in the Wii but not something that's explained anywhere. Reloading via the nunchuk is a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Raj Modi

customer_reviews.title: Great peripheral!
customer_reviews.text: This a great product and I recommend it to anyone that likes light gun games. I played it with Ghost squad and I hear it works well with Umbrella chronicles and House of the dead. The only thing is that you cant point exactly on the screen but more towards the sensor bar. But that is a minor thing and your eyes and aim will automatically adjust. I play Ghost Squad without cursor sights on and it's great! Very much like being at the arcade. I hope more light gun games come out for the Wii because this thing makes the it feel like a true arcade experience.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: A must have for House of Dead!
customer_reviews.text: Wow - we got House of Dead a few days before getting these guns and the difference in gameplay is night and day. The guns turn a pretty good game into a fantastic game that we've spent MANY hours playing together as a family (of 2 teens). Even mom loves blasting zombies. The guns feel quite comfortable and gameplay is quite smooth and natural. I'd highly recommend them if you get HOD (especially at $7.95) - it's, by far, our family's favorite game because of these guns (and the only game we use them for).
customer_reviews.author: da man

customer_reviews.title: as it took the place of the arcade shooter and does quite a good job of it
customer_reviews.text: While not many games took advantage of it, any light gun shooter(such as House of the Dead OVERKILL) definitely deserved to be played with this, as it took the place of the arcade shooter and does quite a good job of it. Over time the adhesive foam on the tip wears down so it doesn't last forever. For the overall experience it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: MSMJ Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Reminds me of the arcade!
customer_reviews.text: This lightgun is still my favorite to use for the shooter games on the Wii. It's one handed use makes it perfect to playwhile enjoying a beverage in the other hand. You wouldn't think a simple plastic shell would make a difference but it's definitely worth the [...] Any time a new light gun shooter game comes out we're always back to using the Perfect Shot. Be sure to pick up two for yourself and a buddy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D

customer_reviews.title: Gun!!
customer_reviews.text: First of all I want to clear up the wrong people have been saying about the Zapper. You can hold the Zapper with hand and it works great so all you out there saying you can't are wrong. Now this new gun is pretty good but it is a little to fat to hold to long. They needed to make the but of the gun slimmer so it would fit in your hand better. A real gun's but is not that fat so why did they make this gun's that way. Don't take me wrong it is a good gun but not the best.
customer_reviews.author: Goofy

customer_reviews.title: Nice but quality control could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these to use on a WII system at a local trade show. One of the guns arrived with the connector (that connects to the controller) out of place. So I couldn't use that one. It is not worth the hassle of returning it to Amazon. Whenever I get a chance I will take it apart and try to fix it myself. The other unit was fine. We used it for 2 days straight and the kids who used it liked it. It felt nice in the hand and was accurate. We will be using it again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: JaS

customer_reviews.title: well not as i expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item thinking that it may be use with any first person game. But i was wrong. Also when you use it with a shot gun game its not as effective as i have too. I can not point my target correctly. But it really gives you the sensation of grabing a gun. I not recommended for kids. It is better for teenagers that likes play shot gun games and of course for adults tjat don't have any sight problems
customer_reviews.author: Victor K Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Wii Perfect Shot.........The title says it all
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few light guns for the Wii, but this is by far the only I use. Great feel to it, way better than just pointing the wii-mote at the screen. Combine this with a few games like "House of the Dead" and "Ghost Squad" instant arcade nostalgia! Any fan of rail shooters should definetly give this one a try.
customer_reviews.author: Ultra Combo TV

customer_reviews.title: Not for action game, works well for shooting only games
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this accessory because it was 'recommended' for the Scarface' WII game. We don't use it for that game, it is very limiting and works well with games that only require shooting action. It fits well in the hand and makes the game play a little more 'realistic' for the enthusiastic player. The aim is very close to true, and the original controller slips easily in and out of place on this accessory.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fields

customer_reviews.title: Love this gun
customer_reviews.text: This gun is exactly what I was hoping for. It works perfectly with Link's Crossbow Training and with Ghost Squad--I'm so happy with it that I'm buying House of the Dead 2 and 3. It's unfortunate that these are the only games that work with this accessory right now. I don't know why one low-score reviewer thinks you need to have enormous hands. I have small hands (even for a woman) and had no trouble holding this gun. Use two hands, people! If you're aware of the limitations of this gun in terms of games, you will not be dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: RedRobot

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these guns and I like them a lot. You do have to be careful when you insert the remote into the gun because it's a tight fit, but I wouldn't really want to slam my 40 dollar remote around anyhow. The port on the bottom of the handle for the nunchuck is a tight fit also, but both fit well and are secure. I would recommend this gun to anyone looking for a Wii gun peripheral.
customer_reviews.author: Jess R.

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect Shot
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much the only alternative you'll ever need to the Wii Zapper. The look and feel of the Perfect Shot really makes you feel like you're back in the arcade again. My only gripe with it would be the fact that sometimes you want to hold it like a real gun with your non-trigger hand resting under the handle BUT you're still holding the nunchuck in that hand and it's quite awkward trying to do both. If not for the "where do I put the nunchuck?" issue this would truely be the "Perfect" Shot.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This gun just feels like quality in your hand. Big beefy grip and nice spring action from the trigger. My sons and I have been blasting bad guys all evening on Ghost Squad with great success. Excellent product. I paid over retail price to get it from Hubbagames instead of Amazon, since everyone is still out of stock after Christmas, but they shipped quick and got it here in time for my son's birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Campin' Cowpoke

customer_reviews.title: Peripheries yes, Wii-mote NO!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Nyko Wii-mote earlier and was slightly disturbed to see that these did not fit well together. This product did fit just fine with the Nintendo version Wii-mote however. I also bought the Nyko Wii-mote chargers that also fit Nintendo Wii-motes fine, but were tough to fit with Nyko's Wii-mote. What's up with that! As far as play ability is concerned you will be limited to fewer actions with this device. For instance most shooters require you to use other buttons on the Wii-mote besides just B. I like it on Nintendo Play's Duck Hunt. It's fun, but basically useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff R.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be alright, fits the wii remote alittle tight.
customer_reviews.text: there's nothing better than holding what feels like a glock in your hand. this has a good weight, the trigger is spring loaded. i have the black wii remote and noticed that its a little rough on the sides of the remote when inserting and removing it. it leaves scratch marks on the sides of the wii remote. i've decided that im going to buy a third wii remote and just keep it in there.
customer_reviews.author: Alkad Mzu

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work good at all.
customer_reviews.text: I really don't think this works very good at all. I bought this gun to go with a game my kids like to play on the Wii. The gun works sometimes and then other times it just is off the mark so much! We used it twice and have since traded it in to gamestop. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Grahamscrackers

customer_reviews.title: Good 3rd Party Gun
customer_reviews.text: Nintendo's own Zapper gun is fine for Link's Crossbow but for some mature games such as 'House of the Dead', these pistol-looking controllers are much cooler and can easily be handle with one hand. I just hate it that you have to remove the jacket and/or the newer Wii Motion Plus before you can insert the WiiMote into the gun shell... but that is the same for every gun.
customer_reviews.author: Master Shifu

customer_reviews.title: WAS NOT HAPPY !
customer_reviews.text: When I got this item it was not packaged well at all. the gun was broke. I had to use my glue gun to glue it back to TOGETHER, So my grandson could use it. I wont order from them again. There was no reason it should have came the way it did. some bubble wrap would have done the trick. or a box. Janice B
customer_reviews.author: jana45

customer_reviews.title: Best of the cheap shells
customer_reviews.text: This is still one of the better cheap shells around. HVG sells a couple Perfect Shot knock offs but stay away from them. The orange flip clip broke within one day, so have some tape or a rubber band handy to use instead when that does happen. If you have the extra $20 or $30 to spend, you could get the Buck Shot Shotgun, or the Penguin (which doesn't need a wii-mote).
customer_reviews.author: xoraclez

customer_reviews.title: fantastic accessory!
customer_reviews.text: i absolutely love this gun attachment! the gun is made really well and the wiimote fits great inside of it. the only con to it is that the handle is really wide - and i have smaller hands so it's a little difficult to hold for extended periods of time (my hand cramps up!). but, otherwise, it's great and a definitely buy if you play any shooter games on the wii.
customer_reviews.author: augustowl

customer_reviews.title: Yay
customer_reviews.text: This makes playing Wii shooters so much easier on my wrist. Unlike most other gun props, this one is actually balanced great. It does lack a second trigger for the A button but most, if not all, Wii games have the gun option for the shooters so they don't even use A. But still keep this in mind. I love it. Great for RE Chronicles.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: pretty good, but would be perfect with two modifications
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good grip, easy to use, good price, easy to insert remote, good quality Improvements Needed: Redesign the remote slot so that the wrist strap and Wii skin can stay on. It is annoying when you have to completely undress the remote to play a a game with the Perfect Shot and then redress the remote when switching to a different game.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Does not connect to Wii controller - returned
customer_reviews.text: My kids were excited to get a new WII gun, but we were very disappointed with this model. The connector inside the gun is set to far back in the gun to actually connect to the WII controller. There was no way to get this to connnect. It was returned. Maybe we received a defective gun, not sure. Must be better guns out there.
customer_reviews.author: supermomw3

customer_reviews.title: best of all guns for the wii
customer_reviews.text: the perfect shot has a true trigger with a feel for the real thing, i had to make some easy mods though for the nyko charging system back plate, all of these mods are done on the perfect shot, 1st on the inside of the perfect shot there is two tabs its for guiding the remote shave them down flush. 2nd use toe nail clippers to cut down the extra plastic above the male input to the wii remote, about half way, 3rd the orange nose has some kind of tape on it shave it down, with these mods and the nyko charging system the gun is really perfect
customer_reviews.author: Gary R. Keith Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I play a lot of shooter games, so figured it was time to add some realism to my playing experiance. I found these to be awkward to use, and you can forget playing Resident Evil games with them, the trigger takes so much movement to work it creates a delay. So the only way I found to enjoy my game is with these in the drawer.
customer_reviews.author: NRage224

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Gun.
customer_reviews.text: I've two of this perfect shot to play with my girlfriend. It's a great gun for certain shooting game but not all. The only complain I've is the handle seems to be a little too big. You might feel some pain on your hand after long period of time playing with this gun. It's no bid deal just need to take a break from time to time. I hope they made the handle a little more comfortable. Over all still good.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Spring needs to be loosened
customer_reviews.text: I think the only problem with this product is that the trigger is a little too tight. It lags response time. I find it difficult switching from the Wii Zapper's trigger to this product. I'm half tempted to open it up and see if I can some how loosen the tension in the spring of the trigger. Overall, this produce is fun to use and enhances the FPS experience.
customer_reviews.author: TuxedoSam

customer_reviews.title: One of the few accessories that just is not perfect for us...
customer_reviews.text: Cool concept, but the application just did not cut it for us. The sighting is off, it does not zero when looking down the barrel's sight. The trigger is just not friendly. Went back to classic style controller with toggle and nunchuck. Oh well, we tried. At least it was not a big expense.
customer_reviews.author: RatherLiveInKeyWest

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to our Wii
customer_reviews.text: The perfect shot works very well. My kids love having an actual gun to play all of the games where weapons are required. The gun works perfectly, my only complaint is that it is a pain to get the controllers into the gun. You have to remove the skin, and the strap which can be difficult for young children.
customer_reviews.author: S and K Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Cheap functional gun
customer_reviews.text: While I'd prefer if it had an integrated nunchuk, the only pistol I could find that does is only available in the UK. For what it is, it's very good. You have to take the controller out of the condom and disconnect the motion plus. It can be used without removing the wrist strap, but I wouldn't advise it.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Mine was missing the orange band. It does not work without it.
customer_reviews.author: Off Grid Jim

customer_reviews.title: Handle is a little bulky
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 6'2" guy and the grip on this gun is pretty big even for my hands. I can't imagine a child being able to really use it very effectively, but it works fine for me. I like that I can hold the nunchuk in my other hand unlike the standard Wii gun.
customer_reviews.author: Big Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Accessory, worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Perfect Shot 3 days ago (12/19/09), and I got it today (12/22/09)! I started using it, though I had a little trouble putting in the Wii Remote, I enjoyed using it! The grip is very comfortable, the trigger moves smoothly, and it gives a realistic feeling like holding a real gun. I love how you can connect the nunchuk to the bottom of the gun for convenience. Though I had minor issues with inserting the Wii Remote (not having problems anymore), overall, the Perfect Shot is a great accessory to have for any Shooter game owner! Overall Rating: 4.5/5
customer_reviews.author: Scott Lim

customer_reviews.title: Pistol for Wii
customer_reviews.text: The butt of the gun is surprisingly thick, and might be a problem for children or adults with small hands. Fitting the controller was tricky - the connection pin in back needs to fit into the back of the controller, and that pin was very slightly crooked. Eventually, I have to bend the plastic slightly to get it to seat. This may have been a defect specific to this unit. The aim also seems slightly off. The controller sits in the gun angled slightly off. As a result, the point of aim is about 6" to a foot above the point of aim. Other than that, the gun functions reliably, and is compatible with the numchuck, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Peter R. Jahn

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with many games, have even used it with Cabela's Dangerous hunts, it is more accurate and easier to point than the one that came with the game.
customer_reviews.author: sr7255

customer_reviews.title: Slightly dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my wife, for Xmas. She gets a kick out of 1st person shooter games. Gun arrived with the front broken. The piece that locks the controller to the gun was missing. The piece wasn't in the box. They put it in that way. They could have given me some tape. Lol! Otherwise it came fast. Rest of order was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wii love it!
customer_reviews.text: My children and I had a blast using perfect shot with games that involve targets. For myself, I have wrist pains sometimes and this allows me to play along with comfort. As other customers have noted, it does allow for better aim as well. We own one and I plan plan to purchase 2 more. Amazon's shipping is wonderful. The one and two day shipping is always on point..never late. Happy New Year everyone.*
customer_reviews.author: T. wilson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Shot of Love Into My Heart!
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT Wii gun. It is definitely better than the Rifle. The ONLY thing about the gun is that if you have the Wii station charger, the controller doesn't fit so easily into the gun, but just be careful and it's not that bad to squeeze it in there. For the price, you CAN'T GO WRONG here!
customer_reviews.author: HyperChicken

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy it used!
customer_reviews.text: At first glance I can tell it wasnt going to work. The plug that you plug in for the nunchuck looks charred and overused. I got this for 17$ used so I guess I got what I payed for. But I expected it to at least work properly, what a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: James Cam

customer_reviews.title: Really fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these, first tried one and we had so much fun using it that I decided to get another one. We bought with the chicken riot game, it's so cool killing the chickens with the gun, even my father used it and all the kids, so is for everyone. Works very good to hold the wii control.
customer_reviews.author: Jannet

customer_reviews.title: Arcade style fun in your house
customer_reviews.text: Arcade style fun in your house! Holds wii remote perfectly in place. Too much fun even. Try not to pistol whip your TV.
customer_reviews.author: Corey C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: wayyy better than the wii zapper! why was this not sold with the wii light gun games?
customer_reviews.author: Don Saldana

customer_reviews.title: Wii Perfect Shot Gun
customer_reviews.text: I first tried this gun out with Medal of Honor II. The game sucked... and shooting the gun was ridiculous. To aim well you have to hold down A and pull the trigger...you can't do that with one hand...sigh. The gun was fine, but I am not sure if there are games out there to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna V.

customer_reviews.title: perfect shot!!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old grandson says it works great! The only thing is with the gun you pull the trigger to reload, then aim at the target and press the button on the numchuk to shot the target. Sounds a bit backwards to me, but he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: The best zombie gun!
customer_reviews.text: Great zombie gun! This gun has destroyed thousands upon thousands of blood sucking zombies! You need one of these!
customer_reviews.author: mikimra

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Shot for Wii
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap-looking plastic but it's worth the price as it makes your FPS possible without having your carpal tunnel flare up. You can aim and shoot with your wrist in a more natural position. Also, it's simple and durable. While it doesn't look 'serious', it sure works well.
customer_reviews.author: W. Gaboda

customer_reviews.title: My child said, "It's OK"
customer_reviews.text: My child, 16 years old, played a couple times. The comments was "Hard to reload and slow when needed to do it fast". The result - return back to regular remote and joystick :-(. Bought for Wii, played "Call of Duty".
customer_reviews.author: ira12

customer_reviews.title: Purchased together with Chicken Riot.
customer_reviews.text: The WII controller was rather difficult to load into the gun. I suppose they do that so the controller won't fall out, but I was afraid I was going to break something when I was stuffing it in there. Otherwise, it works well with the game.
customer_reviews.author: Orona Construction

customer_reviews.title: Decent Wii Gun
customer_reviews.text: This gun works well, but it is a bit wide in the handle for small hands. Of course there's no A button trigger so you either have to reach up to hit the button or hopefully use some combo of shaking or the nun chuck for reloads.
customer_reviews.author: MTH

customer_reviews.title: Hand Fatigue
customer_reviews.text: This gun is pretty good but I have found two main problems with it. 1. The handle is a larger than I expected it to be which makes it uncomfortable to hold for very long. I don't think children or women would find this handle very comfortable at all (smaller hands than men). If the handle was a softer plastic then it might be OK, but it's very hard plastic. 2. The strap needs to be removed from the Wii Remote in order to fit into the gun which is annoying. I'm planning on modifying my gun via Black & Decker drill to allow the strap to remain attached.
customer_reviews.author: Unsay Moon

customer_reviews.title: Great gun!
customer_reviews.text: With a limited number of Wii "pistols" out there and wanting to avoid the two handed guns, I got two of these. They work great! They hook in nicely and the orange latch keeps the remote from moving around inside the gun.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Michaels

customer_reviews.title: nyko perfect shot less then perfect but still good
customer_reviews.text: this product was as described and for some of the games we play on the wii it has changed and made better the experience that we have had with it. a definate purchase for shooting games and the product is put toghether sturdy also. we were worried at first that it would fall apart with the use of my children, but they have been reluctant to tear it up and its been a little over a month now so far so good.

customer_reviews.title: Wii Perfect Shot review
customer_reviews.text: In theory, this is an excellent product for the Wii. But, how effecive and more importantly, how much fun it is depends allot on the game you intend to use it with. If the game is a straight, bare bones shooter, it really is perfect. But for games such as Resident Evil: Umbrella Chronicals, it does not work out as well. The game makes use of several buttons on the Wiimote, but the Wii Perfect makes it difficult at best to get to those buttons with the split second timing required. Overall, its not a bad purchase for anyone I don't think, but with certain games can have a ruinous effect on the overall experience.

customer_reviews.title: Fun with the Perfect Shot Gun
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to use with House of the Dead 2/3. I find it very fun to use with both single and double wielding. The weight of the gun is more realistic. In ease of use, I find it more challenging to use than with the remote alone. The weight definately makes it more difficult to keep you arm up, and aiming is also more difficult. The spring loaded trigger also make your trigger finger tire much faster. This does, however, add to realism, and overall challenge if you are looking for it. Overall I give them a good rating for fun, realism, as well as for great price.

product_meta.title: Perfect Shot for Wii (Colors May Vary)
product_meta.description: Get into the game like never before with the Perfect Shot for Wii. The Perfect Shot is ideal for shooting games on the Wii and is fully compatible with all software designed for the Wii Zapper. The Perfect Shot is designed for one handed operation, giving a pistol-like grip for all your shooting games. The accessory pass-through port also allows for use of Nunchuks and other accessories while the Wii Remote is docked in the Perfect Shot. The tactile trigger also provides a smooth, natural activation of the B-button for less hand strain.
feature_bullets: Wii Remote easily slides into grip and locks into place
Pistol-like grip comfortably fits in the hand and provides an ergonomic grip for extended game play sessions
Trigger button allows easy access to B-button with less strain, and pinpoint accuracy
The accessory pass-through port allows you to use the Perfect Shot and nunchuck or other accessory simultaneously.
One hand remains free to operate the Nunchuk or other attachments simultaneously
